CHAT.comment: CHI and MIT are playing in the living room .

u.a: holds up a toy train .
MIT remembers seeing a Thomas book, and starts looking for it in the toy cabinet .
points at the bookcase
points to a Japanese child magazine that has Thomas in it .

g.ga: reads from the table of contents

u.a: approaches the book and points at Thomas .
hands the toy train to mother .
points at another character (Anpanman) in the picture book .
picks up the toy train and hands it to the investigator .
takes out a pumpkin shaped bucket with toy rails in it .
moves the train in front of CHI .
connects two cars .
takes the two cars and tries to connect them .
CHI is trying to connect the wrong ends of the two cars .
passes the cars to MIT .
moves the train around .
takes the train from MIT and moves it around himself .
looks at the rail parts in the bucket .
pulls up one side of the train towards MIT .
holds up the train and gives it back to CHI .
reaches for the parts of rails in the pumpkin bucket .
helps CHI take out a part of rails .
CHI is trying to take the part out of the bucket, but itπs stuck because the opening is not wide enough .
gives the rail part to MIT .
connects the piece to the others .
takes out another part .
connects the piece .
has trouble taking out another piece .
manages to get it out and passes it to MIT .
again having trouble taking out the rail part out of the bucket .
takes out the piece for CHI .
hands it to MIT .
takes another piece of rail and hands it to MIT .
takes another one out .
gives the piece to MIT .
drops the piece in fron of MIT .
tries to take out a new piece, but it's stuck again .
hands another piece to MIT .
gives another piece to MIT .
MOT is reffering to the carpet, which is not suitable for building rails and playing with toy trains .
the piece CHI is trying to take out is stuck again .
CHI is trying to put the rail part on his mug .
starts drinking from the mug .
places the train on the rails .
points at the train .
gives MIT another piece of rail part .
responding to CHI .
shows MIT the front part of the locomotive .
points at an unconnected rail piece .
connects the piece to the others .
tries to reach for the train .
moves the train close to CHI .
moves the train to one end of the track .
moves the train in the other direction .
returns the train to the CHIπs side of the track .
pushes the train with force; the train derails .
puts the train back on rail .
pushes train off the end of track .
points at the train .
points at the rails .
pushes the train, which derails again .
holds out his right hand toward MIT and moves his fingers and thumb .
touches CHIπs fingers .
touches toes of his own right foot .
moves his toes .
moves the train off the track .
points at the train .
moves the train further .
points at the train .
moves the train around .
